medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain intermittently for approximately one year, described as sharp lower abdominal cramping that became achy and had a twisting sensation. The pain increased in severity at its worst on specific occasions; it was excruciating when the patient filled up with bowel gas before a bowel movement or the bladder with urine. The pain somewhat improved since a certain date. No dysuria, frequency, constipation, diarrhea, or bloody stools reported.
